Hands-On: Can You Dig It? event, originally scheduled for Saturday, April 7, will take place on Saturday, May 5. All other details, including time (8 a.m. to 1 p.m.), remain the same. A new registration form has been added below; anyone registered before 4/10/18 must reregister to ensure their spot at the event. If you are unsure whether you are registered or not, please reach out to Membership Director Ethan Litvin at membership@givebackcincinnati.org.
Time to get to work! Can you dig it? On Saturday, May 5, we will partner with Price Hill Will to help beautify three of their largest community gardens, including Turner Farm, Roberts Academy and LPH Gardens. The Price Hill Recreation Center will serve as our home base for the day! From there, volunteers will split off into three groups to tackle each garden (located two miles or less from the Rec Center; transportation will be provided).  What are the tasks at hand? Great question. Volunteers at each garden will create new garden beds, lay out soil and seed, harvest crops, and pull weeds. Each garden may also include additional maintenance work.  What to bring: Comfortable clothing that you're not afraid to get dirty in. We will provide both gloves and tools prior to the start of the day. Sign-in and registration will begin at 8 a.m. sharp at the Rec Center, along with breakfast (bagels and coffee)! We will have Chick-fil-a delivered for lunch (vegetarian options available) and we will hold an afterparty following the event at Veracruz Mexican Grill (within walking distance!). As always, the first drink is on us. Event Details Date:  Saturday, May 5 Time:  8 a.m. ‚Äì 1 p.m. Location: Price Hill Recreation Center | 959 Hawthorne Ave. | Cincinnati, OH 45205 Parking:  Free parking is available at the Price Hill Recreation Center. Join us for our next Interactive event of the year, Grill & Chill! Volunteers will help prepare food for the residents at the Anna Louise Inn and women from the Off the Streets program, as well as interact with them through a variety of outdoor games (such as corn hole and bingo)! Following the event, we will head over to 3 Points Urban Brewery (331 E. 13th Street) for a GBC Happy Hour.
Anna Louise Inn: Cincinnati Union Bethel's Anna Louise Inn has provided safe, affordable low-income housing for women since 1909. It is a safe harbor, offering a community of women a sense of home. Often, residents have nowhere else to go, and the Inn provides the stability they need to offer them hope and independence. Learn more about the program at www.cubcincy.org/how-we-help/anna-louise-innhousing. 
 
Off the Streets: Off the Streets is an evidence-based program dedicated to serving the needs of women with histories of sex trafficking and exploitation. Off the Streets utilizes a culturally-sensitive, trauma-informed model to help survivors of sex trafficking find safety, recovery and empowerment. Learn more about Off the Streets at www.cubcincy.org/how-we-help/off-the-streets.
 
Event Details Date:  Saturday, August 18 Time:  11 a.m. ‚Äì 3 p.m. Location: Anna Louise Inn | 2401 Reading Road | Cincinnati, OH 45202

post_title: Leadership: Creating a Shared Future in a Fractured World
post_content:
Our deepest sympathies go out to the victims of this morning's tragedy and their families and friends.

For those registered for tonight's panel, the event will continue as planned. In a time of distress, we want to provide a positive discussion on achieving a brighter future.

 
It's hardly a secret that, despite the many technologies and devices we have to connect us, the world feels more divided than ever. So how do we come together -- as volunteers, as a city, as a nation, as peers and colleagues -- to get the big, important work done? How can we create a shared vision for the future if we can't even agree on what the future should be? What is a leader's role in creating that shared vision and, perhaps most importantly, how can we as leaders take the first step to bring others to the table? 
 
We look forward to a robust panel with several local leaders well-versed in navigating many sides of a fractured world: Laura Brunner, President & CEO of the Greater Cincinnati Redevelopment Authority, which focuses on developing and financing projects that reduce poverty, improve land value and create well-paying jobs; Mark Dawes, Entrepreneur in Residence at Hillman Accelerator, a start-up investment firm that focuses on minority and female-led businesses; Eddie Tyner, Midwest Region President of the Gannett network of news publishers, which includes the Cincinnati Enquirer; and Beth Robinson, President & CEO of the Uptown Consortium, which is dedicated to the long-term sustainability of Avondale, Clifton, Corryville, CUF and Mt. Auburn. Come with your questions as our panelists offer practical advice for building consensus and bridges, rather than walls. This event will take place on the fourth floor of Union Hall in its Homeroom area.
 
When: Thursday, Sept. 6
6-7:30 p.m.
 
Where: Union Hall (Homeroom area on floor 4) -  1311 Vine Street Cincinnati, OH 45202
 
Attire: Business casual

2019 Leadership Retreat

Fall Feast is a Give Back Cincinnati event that started in Cincinnati in 2005. In 2016, we expanded our reach and launched our inaugural event in Denver. Join us as we celebrate over 12 years of turkey, smiles and community! Volunteer registration for the Cincinnati feast will open October 2018. For more information, visit our Fall Feast website at www.fallfeast.org.

There's snowplace like home. On December 6, we are gathering at The Globe (Covington) to celebrate YOU! This is a shout out to everyone we've partnered with and to each of our volunteers. We are continuously grateful for your support in furthering our mission to build today's communities and tomorrow's leaders. You truly make the Greater Cincinnati area feel like home! We‚Äôll have light bites and your first round is on us. We will also be raffling off some amazing prizes, so make sure to wear a lucky sock or two.  DJ LPete (from CincySwap!) will bring the beat, and The Globe will cater our apps. Mix & mingle with new and old friends, celebrate community and meet the new Give Back Cincinnati 2019 leadership team. All are welcome! Event Details Date: Thursday, December 6 Time: 7 p.m. ‚Äì 10 p.m. Location: The Globe Covington | 12 E 5th Street | Covington, KY 41011

Join us for a unique, behind-the-scenes dive into what it takes to plan and run a GBC event! This interactive workshop will grant you with the sugar, spice and everything nice that's needed to help make your event a success; you'll have the opportunity to learn more about each individual events committee, their cornerstone events, turn-key essentials, the importance of partnerships, and, of course, each other! This bootcamp is geared towards new committee leads and committee members, as well as those interested in joining a committee. Event Details Date: Saturday, December 15 Time: 10:30 a.m. ‚Äì 1:30 p.m. Location: Greater Cincinnati Foundation - First Floor Meeting Room 200 West Fourth St Cincinnati, Oh 45202

Cincy YP, a program of Give Back Cincinnati that connects young professionals with leadership and networking opportunities, is looking for your help in planning local YP events for 2019! Over the course of this year, Cincy YP will host five different leadership development events for YPs across the tri-state area. This workshop is an opportunity to learn more about Cincy YP, discuss general plans they have in store for 2019 and become a part of the Cincy YP 2019 planning process. Come to hear ideas, share ideas and help develop Cincy YP into the future! Event Details Date: Thursday, February 21 Time: 5:30 p.m. ‚Äì 7 p.m. Location: Union Hall | 1311 Vine Street | Cincinnati, OH 45202 Interested in getting involved with Cincy YP in a leadership capacity? There are five current openings for the Cincy YP board (monthly commitment around 2-4 hours per month)!
  1. Marketing Chair

  3. Communications Chair

Email info@cincyyp.org with interest!

post_title: Civic Engagement: Saving Green by Staying Green
post_content:
Learn how to be more environmentally conscious with our first Civic Engagement event of the year, Saving Green by Staying Green at 3 Points Urban Brewery! During the event, we'll have organizations and booths throughout the venue featuring different aspects of sustainability/recycling, trivia-based activities and a raffle. Each individual registered will receive one drink ticket to use during the event! Current booths include:
  • Cincinnati Metro
  • Cincinnati RedBike
  • City of Cincinnati Office of Environment & Sustainability
  • Habitat for Humanity's ReStore
  • Hamilton County Recycling and Solid Waste
  • Keep Cincinnati Beautiful
  • Liz Ricketts - Co-Founder of The OR and Adjunct Instructor at the University of Cincinnati
  • Mill Creek Alliance
  • Procter & Gamble
Each individual registered will receive one drink ticket to use during the event! Please bring your ID! Event Details Date: Saturday, March 9 Time: 1 p.m. - 3 p.m. Location: 3 Points Urban Brewery | 331 E 13th Street | Cincinnati, OH 45202

Social: Board Game Night at Woodburn Brewery will be a chance for socialites of all skill levels to come together in a casual setting to meet new friends, join old friends and immerse themselves in a variety of available board games. The event will center around board games developed by women, and games will vary in type/style and number of players. Super Heroines, Etc.'s Cincinnati Chapter will provide instruction for each of the games throughout the night, and the first round of drinks is on us! Event Details Date: Tuesday, March 26 Time: 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. Location: Woodburn Brewery | 2800 Woodburn Avenue | Cincinnati, OH 45206

post_title: MadTree Opening Day at the Square Supporting Give Back Cincinnati
post_content: Bigger and better than ever. Give Back Cincinnati's largest fundraiser of the year, in partnership with MadTree Brewing, returns to help bring the party to Fountain Square on Reds Opening Day! Come out for the 100th Annual Opening Day Parade on Thursday, March 28, to enjoy live music and some of the best beer Cincinnati has to offer, thanks to MadTree Brewing. Every beer sold will help support all your favorite Give Back Cincinnati programs and events. On top of that, you get to celebrate the Queen City‚Äôs long-running baseball heritage!  Need a ride downtown? Hop on the free Cincy Brew Bus shuttle running from the MadTree Taproom and Vine Street from 10 a.m. - 5 p.m.! Event Details Date:  Thursday, March 28 Time:  10 a.m.- 4 p.m. Location: Fountain Square at 520 Vine St, Cincinnati, OH 45202 Parking:  Paid parking lot beneath Fountain Square Save the date by visiting the MadTree Opening Day at the Square Facebook event page.

Cincy YP's Networking 101 and Beats returns to help young professionals with their soft skills development in networking! A lot of professionals struggle with understanding the power of networking, and how to build relationships that can be used as a tool to grow in their career path. In this program, we will host socially engaging ice breakers and networking activities lead by leading professional experts to teach young professionals necessary and proper networking skills. First drink is on Cincy YP! More than pure networking, Networking 101 and Beats is a celebration of all local YPs! Throughout the night, we will have a local deejay spinning classic tasteful hip-hop sounds to provide a relaxed setting for those networking for the first or second time as they grow more comfortable with their newly acquired skills. We want to teach professionals that they can have fun while doing serious things. Our DJ host for the evening is DJ Prytime. Please register for our event at the Eventbrite link below! https://networking101andbeats.eventbrite.com Event Details Date: Thursday, April 25 Time: 5:30 p.m. - 8:30 p.m. Location: Queen City Radio | 222 W 12th Street | Cincinnati, OH 45202 This program will also give young professionals the opportunity to make new connections, network with different YP groups and startup business owners. If you would like to volunteer to lead an activity for this particular program or volunteer to help out for this event, please emailinfo@cincyyp.org.

READY, SET‚Ä¶SPRING CLEANING! Join us for our second Hands-On event of the year as we partner with Habitat for Humanity to prepare three Price Hill houses to be rehabbed. Volunteers will provide some GBC TLC by clearing the houses out, cleaning, and providing additional down-and-dirty prep work as needed (please wear clothes you aren't afraid to get dirty in!). Habitat for Humanity will then select three families to live in the houses that we rehab! This is a rain or shine event. Look out for our tent along St. Michael Street when you arrive to sign in! Holtman's Donuts will be provided for breakfast and we will meet up at Veracruz Mexican Grill following the event for lunch and a GBC Happy Hour! Event Details Date: Saturday, April 27 Time: 9 a.m. ‚Äì 1 p.m. Location: 2129 St. Michael Street | Cincinnati, OH 45204 Parking: Street parking available; free parking also available at BodyCote Thermal Processing (710 Burns St, Cincinnati, OH 45204)

post_title: PTT: Paint the Town Avondale/Evanston - Non-Painting Volunteers

post_content: Join us for our next Interactive event of the year, Community Cookout! Volunteers will help prepare food for the residents at the Anna Louise Inn and interact with them through a variety of outdoor games (such as corn hole and bingo)! It will be a fun day of meeting new people and making new friends! Cincinnati Union Bethel's Anna Louise Inn has provided safe, affordable low-income housing for women since 1909. It is a safe harbor, offering a community of women a sense of home. Often, residents have nowhere else to go, and the Inn provides the stability they need to offer them hope and independence. Learn more about the program at www.cubcincy.org/how-we-help/anna-louise-innhousing. Event Details Date: Saturday, June 22 Time: 10 a.m. - 2 p.m. Location: Anna Louise Inn | 2400 Reading Road | Cincinnati, OH 45202

Join us for our next Social event, Know Thy Neighbor! Located in the exciting Bircus Brewing taproom (where beer meets Barnum), you will have the opportunity to get to know other Give Back Cincinnatians (such as yourself!) better through a variety of games and ice-breakers. Whether you recognize a volunteer from a past event or find a new face, this night is about growing your connections within the organization and the Greater Cincinnati Area! This is a 21+ event; please bring your ID with you! All attendees will receive two free drink tickets to use throughout the event.   About Bircus Brewing Company BIRCUS, where the surreal world of circus meets the simple love of beer, will deliver a jaw-dropping, thirst-defying brewery experience. Our performers will juggle clubs, breathe fire, hula hoop, walk on kegs and amaze on the trapeze and aerial silks at the Ludlow Theatre and area venues serving our brew. Raise a glass, see a circus and toast to all. Learn more at https://bircus.com.   Event Details Date: Saturday, June 29 Time: 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. Location: Bircus Brewing Company | 322 Elm Street | Ludlow, KY 41016

Help us celebrate the Fourth! We are excited to be participating in this year's Northside 4th of July Parade, and are looking for volunteers to join our parade ensemble. 😎 Volunteers will represent Give Back Cincinnati throughout the duration of the parade and pass out GBC swag to spectators along the route. A GBC tank top will be available for volunteers while supplies last. More info about parade day below! 

PARKING FOR NON-PARADE VEHICLES:

  • Parking is unavailable for vehicles that aren‚Äôt IN the parade at the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church; all non-parade vehicles will need to park at the McKie Recreation Center (1655 Chase Ave) and shuttle over to the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church (4781 Hamilton Ave). The shuttle runs 9:30AM until 11:30AM. 
STAGING LOT SET UP:
  • When you arrive at the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church‚Äôs parking lot, you will want to find Give Back Cincinnati in section RED. Our exact parade number is 78. If you have difficulties in locating us, please find a Northside 4th of July Parade volunteer and inform them that you are looking for RED 78.

OTHER DETAILS:

  • We will supply all volunteers with GBC tank tops to wear during the parade; however, please feel free to get festive with your accessories.
  • GBC volunteers will either be handing out bottle open keychains to the crowd (do not throw, be sure to hand items to the crowd), waving flags, carrying our banner, squirting water guns, blowing bubbles, or whatever other crazy things we bring along with us. This event is all about having some fun so be ready to have a blast! J
  • Water, sunscreen and bug-spray will be available to all volunteers in our float.
  • There is a port-o-let behind the shuttle pick-up, and two near the staging lot, but that's it. Be prepared.

PARADE END:

Celebrate a successful parade at the Northside Rock ‚Äòn Roll Carnival at Hoffner Park. All GBC volunteers who participated in the parade will receive a beer on us!

  From the Northside 4th of July Parade Facebook event: Parade steps off at noon on Thursday, July 4th 2019. The parade starts at the northern boundary of Northside at Hamilton Avenue and Ashtree Drive and travels south on Hamilton Avenue to Hoffner Park. Roads will close approximately 10 minutes before parade start. The mission of the Northside Fourth of July Parade is to celebrate independence and to serve as a tool for community building. Parade organizers work to invite and involve people from all corners of the community as both participants and viewers. The parade offers a way to get to know one's neighbors through a shared light-hearted activity. Neighbors who know one another and have laughed together are more inclined to be involved and to make their neighborhood a nicer place to live. We invite everyone to join us and help celebrate the Fourth of July! Event Details Date: Thursday, July 4 Time: 11:00 a.m. ‚Äì 3 p.m. Location: Hamilton Avenue and Ashtree Drive | Northside, OH 45223
